item.description:
This bike tour explores Lexington, Bedford, Concord, and Lincoln. We will see the Minuteman Bike Path, the Bedford Depot, Great Meadows Wildlife Refuge, North Bridge, Walden Pond and Decordova Sculpture Park (free admission to cyclists, so we will definitely take a good break here)


The estimated ride length will be approximately 3 1/2 hours (25 miles with some decent hills).

Time has been allotted for enjoying the scenery at various locations.


Google Map of Ride:
http://goo.gl/maps/MZck


Ride Start / Finish:
------------------------------------
Start at 8:30 am / Finish at Noon


Meeting Location:
------------------------------------
Lexington Center Playground
This is a bit of a nook, but there is parking and a public restoom here.


Here is a link just showing the parking / start area

Note: 90 Clark St, Lexington, MA is the closest address i could find.

Follow either Clark or Park to the cul de sac terminus.

See the map below.
http://goo.gl/maps/Ngba


After Ride Options: (Lexington Center)
------------------------------------
Pizza at Bertucci's at (1777 Mass Ave) and / or
sorbet / ice cream at Rancatore's (Across the street on corner of Waltham St / Mass Ave)


What's required
------------------------------------
Bike helmets and a bike in good repair


What's recommended:
------------------------------------
Road / hybrid bikes are a good choice for this ride

Water, spare tire, repair kit, sun screen, snacks, energy bars, rain gear, an extra layer, a bike lock, and a cell phone.


See you then

P.S.

Rain will cancel, so let's hope for good weather!
